Package project.star_wars_universe.util.parsers

Class XMLParser

java.lang.Object
project.star_wars_universe.util.parsers.XMLParser
All Implemented Interfaces:
Parser<String>
public class XMLParser extends Object implements Parser<String>
Parses XML String data into an AppData object, which can be utilized by the application.

  • Method Details

    • parse

      public AppData parse(String content) throws ParsingFailureException
      Parses an XML String into a AppData object. The content is first converted to a Document object using the convertStringToDOM(String) method. The information about the jedi (contained in a <jedi-list> node) is converted to a List using the parseJedi(NodeList) method. The information about the planets (contained in a <planets-list> node) is converted to a List using the parsePlanets(NodeList, List)} method. Using the two lists, an AppData is created and returned. If an exception occurs during the parsing of the data (IOException, SAXException, ParserConfigurationException) the exception is caught and passed to a ParsingFailureException, from which the specific exception can later be extracted using the ParsingFailureException.getException() method.
      Specified by:
      parse in interface Parser<String>
      Parameters:
      content - the XML String that should be parsed.
      Returns:
      an AppData object containing the parsed application data.
      Throws:
      ParsingFailureException - if an exception occurs during the parsing process.

    • convertStringToDOM

      private Document convertStringToDOM(String content) throws IOException, SAXException, ParserConfigurationException
      Converts an XML String to a Document object.
      Parameters:
      content - the XML string which should be converted to a document.
      Returns:
      a Document object derived from the provided String content.
      Throws:
      IOException - if any IO error occurs.
      SAXException - if any parse error occurs.
      ParserConfigurationException - if a DocumentBuilder cannot be created which satisfies the configuration requested.

    • parseJedi

      public List<Jedi> parseJedi(NodeList content) throws ParsingFailureException
      Converts a NodeList to a Set of Jedi. The NodeList containing the <jedi-list> node's child elements is iterated through. The data for each jedi is extracted from the child nodes of each <jedi> node:
      • <name> - the jedi's name
      • <rank> - the jedi's rank
      • <age> - the jedi's age
      • <saber-color> - the jedi's saber color
      • <power> - the jedi's power
      These values are converted from String to their correct data types. Then it is checked whether the current jedi has already been added to the jediList variable and if not it is added to it. If the jedi has already been added to the jediList (JediAlreadyExistsException) or any of the values provided for the fields of the jedi are invalid (InvalidNameException, InvalidRankException, InvalidAgeException, InvalidSaberColorException, InvalidPowerException), the exception is passed to a ParsingFailureException instance, from which the specific exception can later be extracted using the ParsingFailureException.getException() method. The final result is contained in the jediList variable, which is returned.
      Parameters:
      content - a NodeList containing the <jedi-list> node's child elements.
      Returns:
      a List of Jedi.
      Throws:
      ParsingFailureException - if an exception occurs during the parsing process.

    • parsePlanets

      public List<Planet> parsePlanets(NodeList content, List<Jedi> jediList) throws ParsingFailureException
      Converts a NodeList to a Set of Planets. First, the jediList that is passed as an argument to this method is converted to a jedi Map, where the keys are the names of the jedi and the values are the Jedi objects. The NodeList containing the <planets-list> node's child elements is iterated through. The data for each planet is extracted from the child nodes of each <planet> node:
      • <name> - the planet's name. A new Planet class with that name is instantiated.
      • <jedi-population> - the planet's jedi population. It's <jedi> child nodes contain the name of each jedi that populates the planet. For each name it is checked whether it exists in the jedi map. If it does, it gets added to the newly created planet's jedi population. The jedi is then removed form the jedi map.
      Finally, the new planet is added to the planetsList variable. When all planets have been iterated through, the planetsList is returned. If any of the <planet> -> <jedi-population> -> <name> nodes contains a name which doesn't correspond to an existing jedi (JediDoesNotExistException), a jedi with that name already exists on a given planet (JediDoesNotExistOnThisPlanetException) or the planet name is invalid (InvalidNameException), the exception is passed to a ParsingFailureException instance, from which the specific exception can later be extracted using the ParsingFailureException.getException() method.
      Parameters:
      content - a NodeList containing the <planets-list> node's child elements.
      jediList - the List of Jedi that have been fetched from the XML.
      Returns:
      a List of Planets.
      Throws:
      ParsingFailureException - if an exception occurs during the parsing process.
